qas.question: What is the name of the cup that some Catholics think is the Grail?
Which pope used the Santo Caliz for mass in Valencia?
What century is the Santo Caliz from?
When was the Santo Caliz used for mass in Valencia?
According to legend, who took the Santo Caliz to Rome?

context: On <a3_0>9 July 2006<a3_0/>, during Mass at Valencia's Cathedral, Our Lady of the Forsaken Basilica, Pope <a1_0>Benedict XVI<a1_0/> used, at the World Day of Families, the <a0_0>Santo Caliz<a0_0/>, a <a2_0>1st<a2_0/>-century Middle-Eastern artifact that some Catholics believe is the Holy Grail. It was supposedly brought to that church by Emperor Valerian in the 3rd century, after having been brought by <a4_0>St. Peter<a4_0/> to Rome from Jerusalem. The Santo Caliz (Holy Chalice) is a simple, small stone cup. Its base was added in Medieval Times and consists of fine gold, alabaster and gem stones.
